content: Noida's international airport, also called Jewar airport, will be inaugurated on October 30, Union Civil Aviation Minister K Ram Mohan Naidu announced.

content: Donald Trump was treated to a royal reception featuring gun salutes, soldiers on horseback and bagpipes as he met Wednesday with Britain's King Charles III for a historic second state visit, which unfolded far from marching protesters.

title: Bihar Adhikar Yatra: Tejashwi's bid to get upper hand after Rahul's 'vote chori' pitch?
content: Tejashwi Yadav launched 'Bihar Adhikar Yatra' to challenge Nitish Kumar's government on unemployment and crime, following the 'Voter Adhikaar Yatra' led by Rahul Gandhi. This solo move, amidst CM face debates and seat-sharing talks, aims to assert RJD's dominance in the Mahagathbandhan.

title: Patani house firing case: Two accused killed in encounter; joint op by Delhi Police, UP STF
content: In a recent development, the two accused individuals, Ravinda alias Kullu and Arun, involved in the firing incident outside actor Disha Patani's father's residence, have died from injuries sustained during an encounter with Uttar Pradesh's Special Task Force. The incident occurred in Ghaziabad, and the accused were identified as members of the Goldy Brar and Rohit Godara gang.

title: FOMC meeting: Jerome Powell-led US Fed cuts rate by 25 basis points
content: The US Federal Reserve, led by Jerome Powell, has announced a 25 basis points rate cut, setting the federal funds rate to a range of 4 to 4-1/4 percent. This decision comes amidst concerns about moderating economic growth, slowing job gains, and persistent inflation slightly above the 2% target.

title: Microsoft's ultimatum: Return to office; 3 days or consequences
content: Microsoft is mandating employees to return to the office for at least three days a week, starting February 2026, or risk career limitations. The policy, beginning with Seattle-area staff, emphasizes in-person collaboration for advancement, particularly in AI development. Non-compliance could impact performance reviews and access to key projects, signaling a shift from remote work flexibility.

title: Amazon CEO‚Äôs warning: Company‚Äôs culture may be at risk; needs a reset
content: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: 'Hydrogen bomb' incoming? Rahul to hold special presser tomorrow ; 'vote chori' row set to intensify
content: Rahul Gandhi is set to hold a press briefing following his allegations of voter theft, promising a significant expose against the BJP. He previously accused the Election Commission of colluding with the BJP to manipulate elections, citing irregularities in Bengaluru Central's electoral rolls.

title: IT deal renewals: $13 billion contracts on the line; TCS, Infosys, Wipro eye mega wins
content: Indian IT giants like TCS, Infosys, HCLTech, and Wipro are eyeing a substantial $13 billion in contract renewals by December, potentially exceeding last year's $14 billion. Clients are pushing for cost savings and AI-driven efficiencies, influencing deal constructs. While mega deals remain strong, BPO deal sizes are shrinking due to cautious spending amid global economic uncertainties.

title: Amazon US salary hikes: E-commerce giant rolls out $1 bn plan for workers; check details
content: Amazon is investing $1 billion to increase wages and lower healthcare costs for its U.S. fulfillment and transportation workforce. Average hourly pay will exceed $23, with tenured employees receiving raises between $1.10 and $1.90 per hour. Starting next year, the company will also reduce the cost of its basic health plan, lowering weekly contributions and co-pays significantly.

title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm disappointed with‚Ä¶‚Äô: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang after China sends ‚Äòloud and clear‚Äô message to tech companies on banning AI chips
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang expressed disappointment over China's directive to its tech giants, including ByteDance and Alibaba, to cease purchasing Nvidia's AI chips, including the RTX Pro 6000D. This ban extends beyond previous restrictions, signaling a commitment to developing domestic AI systems. Huang acknowledged the fluctuating nature of Nvidia's China business due to ongoing US-China discussions.

title: Bahrain student visa for Indian students: Details on fees, documents & eligibility
content: This guide outlines everything Indian students need to know about applying for a Bahrain student visa. It covers visa types, validity rules, fees in INR, eligibility criteria, required documents, and work rights while studying. With a fast processing time and straightforward requirements, Bahrain is becoming an accessible option for higher education in the Gulf region.

title: Drama! PCB labels Andy Pycroft 'controversial', says he apologised to Pakistan captain
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) issued a statement that ICC match referee Andy Pycroft apologized for the "no-handshake" incident during the India-Pakistan Asia Cup match, saying that it happened due to miscommunication. Earlier, the PCB formally requested Pycroft's replacement for their subsequent match, a request that was denied. Pycroft is the match referee for the game, leaving Pakistan in an embarrassing spot.

title: ‚ÄòWill be addressed satisfactorily‚Äô: Goyal optimistic on India-US deal; calls relations positive
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expressed confidence in resolving trade issues with the US, citing the strong friendship between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump. Recent talks between Indian and US trade negotiators have been positive, aiming for a mutually beneficial agreement.

title: What is Usain Bolt‚Äôs net worth in 2025
content: Usain Bolt's estimated net worth is $90 million in 2025. This reflects his athletic achievements and business ventures. Endorsements from Puma, Visa, and Gatorade contribute to his wealth. Bolt co-founded Bolt Mobility and expanded his restaurant chain. He faced financial challenges in 2023. Bolt enjoys family life in Kingston. His journey shows speed and resilience create lasting influence.

title: Destiny claims Elon Musk and other conservatives got him banned from Twitch
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: Stefon Diggs family tree grows: Cardi B joins legacy; roots run deep
content: Stefon Diggs family tree now includes Cardi B after the rapper revealed she is pregnant with the Patriots wide receiver‚Äôs child. From Cowboys star brother Trevon Diggs to daughter Nova and mom Stephanie, learn how the Patriots receiver‚Äôs family has shaped his life on and off the field, and what Cardi‚Äôs news means for his legacy.

title: Bihar: Darbhanga court rejects bail of man who abused PM Modi's mother
content: A Darbhanga court rejected the bail plea of Mohammad Rizvi, accused of using abusive language against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his mother. Rizvi allegedly made the remarks on August 27 from a Congress platform during Rahul Gandhi's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra'. The court denied bail based on Rizvi's confession to the investigating officer.

title: Putin dials Modi: PM thanks 'friend'; 'India ready to help in Ukraine conflict'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday, received warm greetings from Russian President Vladimir Putin. Modi thanked Putin, reaffirming India's commitment to strengthening their strategic partnership. He also expressed India's readiness to contribute to a peaceful resolution of the Ukraine conflict.

title: Walking isn't enough, says longevity expert: Try this 3x weekly
content: The power of muscles extends beyond physical strength, because it directly affects brain health maintenance. Studies indicate that resistance training exercises boost brain function through better blood circulation, and decreased inflammation levels. The practice helps slow down mental deterioration, while protecting against dementia and other related conditions

title: 'Tarnished son's reputation': Father of AI 171 pilot slams AAIB; seeks 'formal' probe
content: The father of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who perished in the Air India Ahmedabad crash that killed 260, is demanding a formal government inquiry, expressing distress over alleged leaks suggesting his son was suicidal. He refutes claims about his son's mental state, citing his extensive flying experience and lack of prior incidents.

title: Charlie Kirk shooting: Culture-war opportunism; attack on US higher ed
content: The killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk has ignited a fierce debate that places American universities in the dock. While the accused had only brief ties to higher education, attention has shifted to faculty remarks, with over a dozen educators disciplined for mocking Kirk‚Äôs death. Coupled with escalating calls to defund, monitor, or ideologically ‚Äúre-balance‚Äù campuses, the controversy exposes deep political rifts over academia‚Äôs role in American life.

title: SIR in Delhi: EC prepares for revision exercise; uploads voter list of SIR-2002
content: Delhi is preparing for a special intensive revision of electoral polls. The Election Commission has uploaded the 2002 voter list and mapped it with current constituencies. This follows a meeting with state election officials to assess preparedness. A pan-India special revision is expected soon, replacing the annual summary revision.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan embarrassed as Andy Pycroft remains match referee for UAE clash
content: A major standoff threatened Pakistan's Asia Cup 2025 match against UAE after the ICC refused to replace match referee Andy Pycroft, despite PCB objections over his handling of the 'no-handshake' controversy with India. Initial uncertainty saw Pakistan delaying their departure for the game, and the ACC even deleted posts about the match.

title: Pakistan's late drama before UAE match: Match delayed, boycott talks - what we know
content: A cloud of uncertainty looms over the Asia Cup match between Pakistan and the UAE in Dubai, leading to a delayed start amidst reports of potential forfeit. The issue stemmed from Pakistan's objection to Andy Pycroft as match referee, despite the ICC clearing him of misconduct. While the UAE team reached the venue on time, the Pakistan team's departure was initially 'stopped'.

title: ‚ÄòTariffs a mistake‚Äô: Bolton urges India-US talks
content: John Bolton criticized Trump's tariffs on India as a mistake that complicated negotiations and advocated for resuming talks to reduce tariffs and rebuild trust. He highlighted the importance of the Quad in countering China-Russia alignment. Bolton also noted Pakistan's statement regarding Trump's lack of involvement in de-escalating tensions after the Kashmir attack.

title: 'India's growth resilient': S&P reaffirms GDP outlook despite global turbulence
content: S&P Global India Research indicates that despite global economic challenges, India's long-term economic prospects remain robust, fueled by reforms and infrastructure development. The nation is projected to maintain a 6.5% GDP growth in fiscal 2025-26, driven by domestic strengths and increasing global trade participation. India is also poised for expansion in sectors like private credit, shipbuilding, and digital infrastructure.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
content: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: Cardi B announces pregnancy: Rapper expecting baby with NFL beau Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B announced she is pregnant with her fourth child, this time with her boyfriend, NFL star Stefon Diggs. The rapper shared her excitement about motherhood and her supportive relationship with Diggs. Her new album, 'Am I the Drama?', is out now, and she confirmed that the song 'Safe' is about her romance with Diggs, who makes her feel secure.

title: 'Welcome those who assimilate': Trump's stark message for new US citizens
content: US president Trump will now send a congratulatory letter to all new US citizens, emphasising the "sacred bond" they form with the nation's history, culture, and values. The letter, included in the citizenship packet, reminds them of their oath and the freedoms and opportunities the US offers.

title: ‚ÄòAct of terror‚Äô: Man rams car into FBI Pittsburgh office gate; manhunt on
content: Donald Henson, a former military member, is wanted after allegedly ramming a car into the FBI's Pittsburgh field office early Wednesday. Authorities are investigating the incident as a potential act of terror. Henson reportedly crashed into the gate, placed an American flag on it, and fled on foot. A message was found scrawled on the car, which is being examined.

title: Bigger, in colour: EC's new norms for EVM ballot papers; roll-out in Bihar polls
content: The Election Commission has introduced revised guidelines for the design and printing of EVM ballot papers to improve clarity for voters, particularly in the upcoming Bihar assembly election. These changes include larger color photographs of candidates, uniform font sizes for names, and the use of pink-colored 70 GSM paper for assembly elections.

title: Cardi B pregnant: Confirms baby with Stefon Diggs; fans react
content: Popular rapper Cardi B is expecting a child with Stefon Diggs. She revealed this on CBS Mornings. The baby is due in February 2026. This is her first child with Diggs. She has three children with Offset. The couple started dating in late 2024. They were seen together at a Knicks game.

title: Lodha Developers 'fraud' case: Crime branch arrests ex-director Rajendra N Lodha
content: Mumbai's crime branch has apprehended Rajendra N. Lodha, along with accomplices, for allegedly defrauding Lodha Developers of Rs 85 crore. The real estate firm accused its former director, Rajendra Narpatmal Lodha, his son, and associates of fraud, misappropriation, and criminal breach of trust. Rajendra Lodha is accused of unauthorized property sales, undervaluing land deals, and illegal TDR transactions.

title: Bahrain visa for Indians: On-arrival access, application tips, and entry rules
content: Indian citizens visiting Bahrain can obtain a visa on arrival for short stays, provided they meet basic entry requirements. Alternatively, travellers may apply online in advance by submitting necessary documents. This guide explains eligibility criteria, required paperwork, step-by-step application procedures, and arrival protocols at Bahrain International Airport, helping ensure a smooth and well-prepared travel experience.

title: 'SpaceX' cocaine: Oz pilot dies in plane crash; cops find 200kg of drugs
content: A plane crashed in Brazil, revealing a shocking discovery. Authorities found approximately 200 kg of cocaine concealed in SpaceX-labeled packaging. The Australian pilot, Timothy J. Clark, was found dead at the crash site. The plane, registered in Zambia, had extra fuel tanks. Police are investigating the drug trafficking operation and the pilot's knowledge of Brazilian air routes.

title: 'Navalny poisoned': Wife says labs reveal foul play; claims Putin responsible
content: Yulia Navalnaya, wife of Alexei Navalny, alleges that independent lab tests confirm he was poisoned while in prison. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024. The labs, located in two countries, concluded that Navalny was killed by poisoning. Navalny previously survived a poisoning attempt in 2020.

title: SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
content: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

title: Pakistan vs UAE in doubt? ACC social media post creates further chaos
content: Tensions escalate within the Pakistan camp ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against UAE, as the ACC unexpectedly deleted its social media post promoting the game, raising concerns about Pakistan's participation.

title: 'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
content: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: State Cabinet approves ‚ÄòCM With Me‚Äô initiative to boost public-government interface and transparency
content: A key feature of the programme is the creation of a comprehensive Citizen Connect Centre, which will serve as a central hub for citizen feedback, grievance redressal and public communication

title: Raj Thackeray‚Äôs cartoon targets Amit Shah, son, over Indo-Pak match
content: The cartoon features the question in the background: ‚ÄúWho actually won? Who actually lost?‚Äù The post comes after India won in the recent Asia Cup match played against Pakistan.

content: After the completion of SIR to remove dead, migrated and duplicate voters from rolls, the ECI expects the voting percentage in urban centres such as Bengaluru to go up in future election

title: Rains damage connecting roads to Mussorrie, hotels offer free stay to hundreds of stranded tourists
content: Hotel owners says over 3,000 travellers are stranded, unable to find their way to Dehradun; bid to fly patients from the ITBP helipad in Mussoorie fails; police ask people not to take out vehicles

title: Education Ministry tells CBSE, Central schools to screen film based on PM Modi‚Äôs childhood
content: Schools directed to screen Chalo Jeete Hain between September 16 and October 2; film will serve as case study on moral reasoning, help students reflect on character, service, responsibility, says Ministry

title: DPS Nacharam student injured after ‚Äòbirthday bumps‚Äô
content: The 14-year-old undergoes surgery after testicular damage;¬†doctors advise three months of complete bed rest after which full recovery will be assessed; school staff, classmates booked

title: Hunger strike for Ladakh‚Äôs Statehood enters seventh day; will remain ‚Äòapolitical‚Äô, say protesters
content: The Leh Apex Body said that it has decided to keep the movement ‚Äúapolitical‚Äù and members of the Congress party associated with the movement have been asked to step down

title: Former Hurriyat chairman Abdul Gani Bhat, who held talks with NDA leaders two decades ago, passes away
content: Bhat, 89, was a staunch advocate of talks with both Indian and Pakistani governments; met BJP leader and then-Deputy PM L.K. Advani in 2004; slammed by Hurriyat for willingness to talk to New Delhi

title: Disha Patani Bareilly home firing: Two shooters killed in encounter
content: The encounter was carried out in a joint operation by Delhi Police Special Cell, Uttar Pradesh STF and Haryana STF, officials said

title: ED takes ex-MUDA Commissioner Dinesh Kumar into custody
content: The Directorate of Enforcement (ED) has taken former Commissioner of Mysuru Urban Development Authority (MUDA) G.T. Dinesh Kumar into custody

title: EU-India partnership set for upgrade
content: EU‚Äôs top diplomat Kaja Kallas releases strategic agenda¬†on trade, technology, security, defence and climate; however, India‚Äôs military exercises with Russia and its continued purchase of Russian oil are seen in Brussels as potential obstacles to the deepening of the relationship with New Delhi

title: EVMs to display colour photographs of candidates beginning with Bihar polls
content: ECI has revised norms for EVM ballot papers; serial numbers of candidates will now be displayed more prominently, their faces will occupy three-fourths of photo space

title: As Project Cheetah turns three, female cheetah relocated from Kuno to Gandhisagar
content: Gandhisagar now has three cheetahs, including two males who were moved there from Kuno in April this year

title: CPI(M) MP John Brittas raises concern over outsourcing operational backend work of parliamentary e-mail system to a private firm
content: The Rajya Sabha member argues that this move can compromise the confidentiality of communications sent by parliamentarians through their official email accounts

title: Catholic Church opposes BJP plan to celebrate PM Modi‚Äôs birthday inside church
content: Father Sebastian Arolichalil denounces poster circulating on social media. Says neither the church or the diocese has anything to do with it. He denies hosting any such function and condemns the poster featuring Muthalakkodom church.

title: Two construction workers killed as compound wall falls on them in Idukki
content: Munnar tahsildar says Revenue department in January had issued a stop memo for the construction work on the resort

title: Interim flood relief of ‚Çπ1,600 crore is ‚Äògrave injustice‚Äô to Punjab, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Opposition leader says State has suffered a loss of at least ‚Çπ20,000 crore, lakhs of people lost their houses and over four lakh acres of paddy crop got destroyed in the floods

title: Continuous reforms a must in armed forces, says CDS
content: Gen. Chauhan says it will ensure preparedness in an increasingly complex global security environment; reiterates armed forces‚Äô commitment to remain self-reliant and future-ready

title: Mention Lingayat in religion column during survey, says mahasabha
content: The Dharwad unit of the Jagatika Lingayat Mahasabha has made an appeal to the followers of Basavanna

title: Naidu to finalise Godavari Pushkarams-2027 budget in October
content: ‚Çπ456 crore drainage, roads and pushkar ghats development underway, additionally ‚Çπ290 crore AMRUT 2.0 works tender to be invited, says Minister Narayana

title: Kalyana Karnataka is now seeing a significant increase in development initiatives: Khandre
content: The Minister was addressing a gathering after unfurling the National Flag to mark Kalyana Karnataka Utsav celebrations in Bidar

title: New India led by Modi is inspiring the world: U.P. CM Yogi
content: Seva Pakhwada will be observed¬†from September 17 to October 2, featuring a series of creative and socially unifying activities to mark Prime Minister Narendra Modi‚Äôs 75th birthday

title: Watch: Tejashwi Yadav launches Bihar Adhikar Yatra against Nitish Kumar government
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav kicked off his Bihar Adhikar Yatra on September 16, calling it a fight against unemployment, inflation, and atrocities against women.

title: Watch: Why India could lose billions in US trade
content: India‚Äôs exports to the United States dropped sharply in August, with shipments falling to $6.7 billion. Experts warn prolonged duties could cost India $30‚Äì35 billion in exports and impact jobs if not addressed promptly.

title: Despite late OTPs, payment failures, online RTI queries may cross 1 million this year
content: Already, 7,66,167 requests have been filed so far in 2025. These numbers do not represent all RTI applications sent to the Central government, as many are filed physically

title: Karnataka govt. has approved funds for night-landing facility at Shivamogga Airport, says Madhu Bangarappa
content: Lok Sabha member B.Y. Raghavendra and district in charge minister Madhu Bangarapa recently engaged in a public spat over the absence of night-landing facility at the airport

title: Lack of effective control on maintenance activities led to Air India flight‚Äôs emergency landing in 2024, finds probe
content: Investigation report states that the DGCA headquarters may take appropriate action against Air India for failing to ensure the satisfactory completion of scheduled tasks and for not monitoring the oil uplift/oil consumption data of the Auxiliary Power Unit

title: Turning Sabarimala into global pilgrimage centre among aims of Ayyappa sangamam: Vasavan
content: TDB plans to explore investment opportunities for improving basic infrastructure at pilgrimage centre

title: Thieves try their luck with Thiruvonam Bumper lottery tickets in Kozhikode district
content: A lottery agent from Koyilandy claimed that he lost 52 Thiruvonam Bumper tickets in a theft which reportedly took place last Sunday

title: SBI yet to release Kingfisher asset sale money, staff await dues
content: A total of 2,200 Kingfisher employees have filed claims with the liquidator‚Äôs office for a total sum of ‚Çπ3,000 crore; total dues owed by Kingfisher to various creditors not yet determined

title: People‚Äôs cooperation vital to make Andhra Pradesh dump yard-free, says MA&UD Minister Narayana
content: Government working towards making roads clean, providing safe drinking water, and putting in place a good solid and liquid waste management system in urban areas, he says

title: Archbishop Emeritus Mar Jacob Thoomkuzhy passes away at 94
content: His life spanned decades of tireless pastoral service, institution building, and social empowerment ‚Äî especially among the struggling migrant Christian communities in Malabar. He was the first bishop of the Mananthavady diocese and later served as the archbishop of Thrissur
